numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a pattern in the graph.
2. If the parents of a student are richer, then the chance of admission for the student increases.
3. If a student has a legacy in the family, then the chance of admission for the student increases.
4. The graph rises exponentially for richer legacy students.
5. The top 50% have a 300% increase in their chance of admission.
6. The top 0.1% have a 700% increase in their chance of admission.
7. A less wealthy legacy student has a lower chance of admission than these groups.
8. I wonder about the reason for this policy.
9. Rich legacy parents donate a lot of money to a school.
10. If the child of a rich legacy parent is accepted, then the parent is inclined to donate more money to the school.
11. This issue relates to my community.
12. Many people in my community apply to colleges.
15. Some applicants deserve the ability to go to a good Ivy League school.
16. Some of these applicants will miss an opportunity.
17. Some of these applicants will miss an opportunity because another applicant has rich legacy parents.
18. The headline is: What are colleges really looking for in an application: rich legacy parents!
